teams.name: Guys holding fish
teams.loan_because: We feel an affinity for entrepreneurs that make their living by fishing, selling fish, or attempting to make their lives better because of their proximity to the ocean, or freshwater locales...
teams.description:
We love fish and/or fishing so much that many of us have chosen to present ourselves on KIVA with a photo of ourselves, holding a fish!  We welcome "gals" to join, as well, the name of the team notwithstanding...  

We certainly support "sustainable" fishing, but also recognize that sometimes, our "Western" views of resource management may not match the needs of the very desperate folks, in other countries, struggling to make a living, or even providing food for their families ...  Our intent is to help the struggling, without regard to their profession or trade.  We believe that our lending record well represents that goal, as we are a pretty diverse group, with very diverse lending interests....

teams.name: LOTUS: Lend Out To Uplift Self-sufficiency
teams.loan_because: We care about people striving to enhance their economic self-sufficiency and wish to support their entrepreneurial endeavors. It just takes one small step by each of us lending on kiva. Together we can make it easier for hard working people to get the much-needed capital to sustain and grow their business. We feel blessed to be able to support the aspirations of so many loan recipients who persevere tenaciously for a better quality of life with dignity. Kudos to Kiva.org that allows us to connect for this common cause.
teams.description:
In our team, we have a vision to change lives in novel ways. Our team's origin began with a Kiva Card (gift certificate) whose recipient founded this team. Inspired by Kiva Fellow, Jessica Heinzelman's talk, our founder dreamed to take us on a cruise, beyond the realm of lending targets and team statistics. Frequent & occasional lenders are free to choose who to lend to, how much and when in an amiable team ambience nurtured by Kiva Fellows, Kiva Editor & Translators, artists, writers, entrepreneurs, workers, retired people, families, parent + kid(s), students, teachers, and professionals. Our diversity & portfolio enable our discovery of social values inherent in the Kiva micro-lending ecosystem whose issues we debate objectively. Experienced members are gratified to enhance our grasp of nuances in lending. We wish to work with volunteers in the team, Kiva Friends, http://kivafriends.org and our supporters to engage in activities that promote Kiva. Our journey to strengthen and grow the Kiva ecosystem has room for more. JOIN NOW, and check out our team, to convince yourself that it can be your team too.

LINKS TO SEE ALSO:
1. Kiva Updates:http://www.kiva.org/updates/kiva 
2. KF Blogs:http://www.kiva.org/updates/fellows 

(Thanks Anh D Pham for letting LOTUS team on Kiva to use the exquisite image of the lotus flower you photographed in Vietnam)

teams.name: San Diego Microfinance Alliance
teams.loan_because: We believe in the power of microfinance to alleviate poverty and empower the poor.  We know that microfinance creates opportunities to improve lives, not just fleeting fortunes.
teams.description:
We realize we are privileged to live and work in the beautiful city of San Diego, and we feel that compared to much of the world, we have abundant resources.  We want to share this wealth with entrepreneurs in developing countries.

We unite the microfinance community in San Diego by hosting networking events and speakers series and providing a website that serves as an events calendar, jobs board, volunteer database, community forum, and news source.

teams.name: The Capital Group
teams.loan_because: Capital Group is committed to making a positive impact on our global communities.  Our associates care about making the world a better place, and the power of micro-lending can support entrepreneurship and positive social change.  Access to capital is foundational to start or grow businesses, create jobs, alleviate poverty, empower women and families, and create sustainable opportunities.  Every dollar loaned on Kiva goes directly to funding loans, and once repaid, can be re-invested over and over again.
teams.description: Capital Group and our associates, personally support more than 2,000 nonprofit organizations around the world.  We are leveraging the global network of Kiva, and striving to make meaningful loans to entrepreneurs across 83 countries.

teams.name: Smile Train
teams.loan_because:
There are millions of children with unrepaired cleft lips and palates who have little to no prospect of ever being helped. Their parents are so poor they could never afford surgery. Being born with a cleft in a developing country is truly a curse, and no one knows how many newborns with clefts are killed or abandoned right after birth.  

Through Smile Train's free cleft surgery program, a 45 minute surgery gives these children a future and a second chance at life that they never thought they'd get. Let's change the world, one smile at a time!

Through our Kiva lending we want to raise awareness and support of the wonderful work Smile Train does in providing free cleft repair surgeries around the world. If our team logo is displayed on loans' top lending teams we hope other Kiva lenders will learn about Smile Train's work too.  Won't you join us?
.
teams.description:
We are a diverse group of Kiva lenders from different backgrounds and different areas of the world who share a common desire to support the effort to bring a repair surgery to every child who needs one.  Our team also includes staff members of Smile Train and Kiva and other microfinance ventures.  We would be happy for you to join our team too!

The little girl in our team logo is Pinki Sonkar.  She was born with a severe cleft into a family that was surviving on less than a dollar a day in a poor rural village in India. She could not go to school because the other children threw rocks at her.  Smile Pinki tells the story of how her life was changed forever by a free repair surgery at a Smile Train partner hospital.  Contact a team captain for more information if you would like a free DVD of this Academy Award winning documentary.

Where is Pinki Now - http://bit.ly/WhereisPinkiNow - This 5 minute video has interviews with Pinki's parents and teachers and video of Pinki in school.  You can see that cleft surgery brings a total transformation to the lives of these kids.

Wang Li Got Married - http://bit.ly/WangLi - this video tells the moving story of Smile Train's very first patient and how her life was totally changed.

Smile Train in Mexico - http://bit.ly/SmileMexico - this video is for Adrián and the Arenal Group. As a team we loaned to help his parents, and we hope that through Smile Train Adrián will get the care that he needs.

Kiva Team Smile Train fund raiser page - http://bit.ly/DonateTeamSmileTrain - If you would like to make donation to support Smile Train's work you can do so here.  Even if you don't make a donation, please sign our guest book!      Thank you for helping the kids!      

Other tax advantaged donation links:
Canada - http://www.canadahelps.org/CharityProfilePage.aspx?CharityID=s98822
Great Britain - http://www.smiletrain.org.uk/
India - http://www.smiletrainindia.org/
Italy - http://www.smiletrain.it/

Check out the distribution of our team's impact around the world:  http://kivafolio.appspot.com/report?user=Smile_Train

Check our team statistics:  http://smiletrain.vijayr.net/stats.php
.

1.We believe that each and every person is important.
2. We believe that all people should be treated fairly and kindly.
3. We believe that our churches are places where all people are accepted and where we keep on learning together.
4. We believe that each person must be free to search for what is true and right in life.

teams.name: AVE & family
teams.loan_because:
We take our friendship to a next level. We live in an environment where we do not experience poverty in any way. We have the advantage to live in an intellectual and wealthy community. The initiative of doing something collateral started this Christmas period. Where there is time for some reflection and thoughts about the whereabouts of the underprivileged society.  
As I already mentioned we live in a more or less work hard & play hard culture, with lots of wining & dining and vacations. Just like the song: “We are the world, we are the children. We are the ones who make a brighter day, so let’s start giving”. It gives a good feeling if we can help other people throughout the world.

Our fraternity (see below) established in the early nineties. Nearly every member started at the Amsterdam Academie, which is a university for “Banking and Insurance industry”. Consequently we have a major communal interest in economics. We believe Microfinance is a transparent way of being involved in charity. There are no extra costs for e.g. over-priced consultants. The ability of choosing your own projects is very interesting and above all, a very effective method to increase the standard of living. 

All in all I wish we can get inspired by these business proposals provided by Kiva! Hoping Kiva becomes our partner in helping people all over the world.


Erik Beekmans
teams.description: Heerendispuut AVE Amsterdam, is fraternity established in 1992, with around 30 members. After more then a decade, the intention of the group changed from a very active student society into a group of friends with shared interests. Besides some traditions like Christmas dinners and ski trips, we ceased acting as a usual fraternity, basically because we’re beyond our student period.

teams.name: The Stella Community
teams.loan_because: ...in memory of Stella Mullins
teams.description:
This lending community was created on December 24th, 2008. This date is significant because it was not only the day after Stella Mullins passed away, but it's also her birthday. 

Every year, Stella's loved one's would celebrate her life by celebrating her birthday on Christmas Eve. We will continue to celebrate her life and legacy by reflecting her character  through acts of love for people throughout the world. 

Stella and her husband, Jim, poured themselves out to help, love, provide for, and care for their family.  We recognize that there are many "Stella's" throughout the world. We want to honor the ways in which these people provide for and care for their families by helping them with their small business.

teams.name: Smile Train
teams.loan_because:
There are millions of children with unrepaired cleft lips and palates who have little to no prospect of ever being helped. Their parents are so poor they could never afford surgery. Being born with a cleft in a developing country is truly a curse, and no one knows how many newborns with clefts are killed or abandoned right after birth.  

Through Smile Train's free cleft surgery program, a 45 minute surgery gives these children a future and a second chance at life that they never thought they'd get. Let's change the world, one smile at a time!

Through our Kiva lending we want to raise awareness and support of the wonderful work Smile Train does in providing free cleft repair surgeries around the world. If our team logo is displayed on loans' top lending teams we hope other Kiva lenders will learn about Smile Train's work too.  Won't you join us?
.
teams.description:
We are a diverse group of Kiva lenders from different backgrounds and different areas of the world who share a common desire to support the effort to bring a repair surgery to every child who needs one.  Our team also includes staff members of Smile Train and Kiva and other microfinance ventures.  We would be happy for you to join our team too!

The little girl in our team logo is Pinki Sonkar.  She was born with a severe cleft into a family that was surviving on less than a dollar a day in a poor rural village in India. She could not go to school because the other children threw rocks at her.  Smile Pinki tells the story of how her life was changed forever by a free repair surgery at a Smile Train partner hospital.  Contact a team captain for more information if you would like a free DVD of this Academy Award winning documentary.

Where is Pinki Now - http://bit.ly/WhereisPinkiNow - This 5 minute video has interviews with Pinki's parents and teachers and video of Pinki in school.  You can see that cleft surgery brings a total transformation to the lives of these kids.

Wang Li Got Married - http://bit.ly/WangLi - this video tells the moving story of Smile Train's very first patient and how her life was totally changed.

Smile Train in Mexico - http://bit.ly/SmileMexico - this video is for Adrián and the Arenal Group. As a team we loaned to help his parents, and we hope that through Smile Train Adrián will get the care that he needs.

Kiva Team Smile Train fund raiser page - http://bit.ly/DonateTeamSmileTrain - If you would like to make donation to support Smile Train's work you can do so here.  Even if you don't make a donation, please sign our guest book!      Thank you for helping the kids!      

Other tax advantaged donation links:
Canada - http://www.canadahelps.org/CharityProfilePage.aspx?CharityID=s98822
Great Britain - http://www.smiletrain.org.uk/
India - http://www.smiletrainindia.org/
Italy - http://www.smiletrain.it/

Check out the distribution of our team's impact around the world:  http://kivafolio.appspot.com/report?user=Smile_Train

Check our team statistics:  http://smiletrain.vijayr.net/stats.php
.

teams.name: 'My Family and Other Animals'
teams.loan_because: We believe in demonstrating fidelity to our ideals and communion with our fellow humans.
teams.description:
We are a group of friends & family with the simple aim of helping those less advantaged to help themselves. We believe the most effective way to achieve this is through bypassing commercial banking and hegemonic institutions; to lend directly to people in the developing world according to their own priorities & goals.

Our group name is taken from the title of a book by Gerald Durrell; A humorous account of his childhood growing up on the Greek island of Corfu in the 1930's. He was a renowned naturalist, author, pioneering conservationist, and a relation of our team captain & family.

teams.name: hi5 Community on Kiva!
teams.loan_because: “Kiva’s principles of entrepreneurship, serving a global community, and leveraging the power of crowds are very complementary to hi5’s mission, so it seems only natural that we join them in the fight to help eradicate poverty in many parts of the developing world,” said Ramu Yalamanchi, CEO of hi5. “By linking our user base with the profiles of Kiva entrepreneurs, we are connecting a diverse group of people who want to change our world for the better and ensure the right resources exist to do it.”
teams.description: Headquartered in San Francisco, hi5 is one of the world’s largest and fastest growing social networks and mobile web networks. Our focus is to empower our users to build and maintain connections between friends and family online. With over 56 million unique visitors every month, hi5 is a top 20 website globally and the number one social network in 31 countries across Latin America, Europe, Asia and Africa. The service is available in 37 languages, delivering localized content and applications to users worldwide.

With Kiva members' help these brothers and sisters, our fellow humans, have been given a ray of hope that only they can build upon for a brighter future.
teams.description: We have a very passionate core group of members who make consistent loans.  Join us today and set Thailand as your team choice.   Let's live up to the slogan "Amazing Thailand" with our generous lending activities.

teams.name: Three Cups of Tea - CAI Supporters
teams.loan_because: we have been touched, moved, inspired, and motivated by the example of Greg Mortenson, humanitarian, peace-maker, and author of "Three Cups of Tea: One Man's Mission To Promote Peace... One School At A Time."  Please read it if you have not already done so: your life will be changed.  We also support the Central Asia Institute (CAI), and Pennies For Peace (www.penniesforpeace.org)
teams.description: We lend especially to women in Pakistan and Afghanistan, where Mortenson and CAI are active in establishing community schools in rural areas.

teams.name: Saint Joseph's University
teams.loan_because: When the heart is touched by direct experience, the mind may be challenged to change. Personal involvement with innocent suffering, with the injustice others suffer, is the catalyst for solidarity which then gives rise to intellectual inquiry and moral reflection...Students, in the course of their formation, must let the gritty reality of this world into their lives, so they can learn to feel it, think about it critically, respond to its suffering and engage it constructively. They should learn to perceive, think, judge, choose and act for the rights of others, especially the disadvantaged and the oppressed. --by Peter-Hans Kolvenbach, SJ, from "The Service of Faith and the Promotion of Justice in American Jesuit Higher Education"
teams.description: A Jesuit university committed to social justice.

teams.name: hi5 Community on Kiva!
teams.loan_because: “Kiva’s principles of entrepreneurship, serving a global community, and leveraging the power of crowds are very complementary to hi5’s mission, so it seems only natural that we join them in the fight to help eradicate poverty in many parts of the developing world,” said Ramu Yalamanchi, CEO of hi5. “By linking our user base with the profiles of Kiva entrepreneurs, we are connecting a diverse group of people who want to change our world for the better and ensure the right resources exist to do it.”
teams.description: Headquartered in San Francisco, hi5 is one of the world’s largest and fastest growing social networks and mobile web networks. Our focus is to empower our users to build and maintain connections between friends and family online. With over 56 million unique visitors every month, hi5 is a top 20 website globally and the number one social network in 31 countries across Latin America, Europe, Asia and Africa. The service is available in 37 languages, delivering localized content and applications to users worldwide.

teams.name: Global Access Foundation
teams.loan_because:
to build bridges
to build ponds
to build people
teams.description:
Building Bridges

"Building Bridges" means we want to create relationships between groups, individuals and organizations. We are literally brokering relationships and giving our friends away.

Building Ponds

Micro-financing Entrepreneurs, Funding Community Projects and empowering people to not only get their needs met, but be the active leaders of meeting needs by giving them access to the resources and building their integrity by covenanting with them until they have done the work themselves is, "Pond Building" at its best!

Building Leaders

"Building People" is my favorite. We want to go, seek and train leaders. We are actively looking for people who are ready to contribute to their communities and have the ideas, heart and most of the know-how for doing the work. We simply want to help them connect the dots.

This work is all over the world. From our backyard in Washington, DC to India, Nepal, Cambodia, Mexico and one more at the present.

teams.name: LOTUS: Lend Out To Uplift Self-sufficiency
teams.loan_because: We care about people striving to enhance their economic self-sufficiency and wish to support their entrepreneurial endeavors. It just takes one small step by each of us lending on kiva. Together we can make it easier for hard working people to get the much-needed capital to sustain and grow their business. We feel blessed to be able to support the aspirations of so many loan recipients who persevere tenaciously for a better quality of life with dignity. Kudos to Kiva.org that allows us to connect for this common cause.
teams.description:
In our team, we have a vision to change lives in novel ways. Our team's origin began with a Kiva Card (gift certificate) whose recipient founded this team. Inspired by Kiva Fellow, Jessica Heinzelman's talk, our founder dreamed to take us on a cruise, beyond the realm of lending targets and team statistics. Frequent & occasional lenders are free to choose who to lend to, how much and when in an amiable team ambience nurtured by Kiva Fellows, Kiva Editor & Translators, artists, writers, entrepreneurs, workers, retired people, families, parent + kid(s), students, teachers, and professionals. Our diversity & portfolio enable our discovery of social values inherent in the Kiva micro-lending ecosystem whose issues we debate objectively. Experienced members are gratified to enhance our grasp of nuances in lending. We wish to work with volunteers in the team, Kiva Friends, http://kivafriends.org and our supporters to engage in activities that promote Kiva. Our journey to strengthen and grow the Kiva ecosystem has room for more. JOIN NOW, and check out our team, to convince yourself that it can be your team too.

LINKS TO SEE ALSO:
1. Kiva Updates:http://www.kiva.org/updates/kiva 
2. KF Blogs:http://www.kiva.org/updates/fellows 

(Thanks Anh D Pham for letting LOTUS team on Kiva to use the exquisite image of the lotus flower you photographed in Vietnam)

teams.name: Tareto Maa
teams.description:
Tareto Maa is a grassroots nonprofit in Kenya, East Africa, whose objective is to empower the local community while eradicating the tradition of female genital mutilation (FGM) and child marriages within the Maasai people.  

The members of this Kiva group who are spokespersons of Tareto Maa are Gladys (TM Kenya), Jackie (TM USA), Philippe (TM Austria) and Armin (TM Germany). These members will publish project news on behalf of Tareto Maa. All other messages on the message board reflect private opinions of the group members.

The messages on the group’s board should discuss the work of Tareto Maa, further topics that relate to child rights, women's rights, community development, and the fight against gender-based violence, and also, of course, Kiva-related topics of all kinds.

For further information about Tareto Maa, please join our page on Facebook: www.facebook.com/TaretoMaa, or take a look at our WIKI: www.appropedia.org/Tareto_Maa 
This article describes why and how Tareto Maa was founded: http://worldpulse.com/node/62258

teams.name: Humanist
teams.loan_because: It takes people to help people.  We believe in good.
teams.description:
Humanists strive to live good and ethical lives, with no belief in the supernatural.  We give meaning and purpose to our lives through reason, compassion and action.

Most Atheists and non-religious people ARE Humanists, but don't realize it!

Our team helps the poor, builds the Humanist community and shows that non-religious people give, care and share.

We are endorsed by the American Humanist Association, British Humanist Association and International Humanist and Ethical Union.

teams.name: South Pacific Business Development (SPBD)
teams.loan_because: SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. It is these qualities which make people credit worthy, not the collateral which traditional banks demand.
teams.description: A group of passionate individuals that recognize the importance of SPBD's work in Samoa. We believe SPBD allows women and their families to pursue their dreams and achieve their full potential.

teams.name: The Siegfried Group, Boston
teams.loan_because: We are part of an entrepreneurial company, and we are particularly interested in seeing the results of the funds we invest to other entrepreneurs all over the world.
teams.description: A CPA firm established in 1988, The Siegfried Group, LLP is a professional services partnership that delivers a full range of accounting and financial resource services to major public companies and other large organizations throughout the United States (including a Big Four firm). The Siegfried Group provides high-caliber, experienced accounting and financial professionals to assist with the implementation of high-priority, critical financial work. Through long-enduring relationships, the Firm helps clients extend their in-house human resources capabilities with a customized, consistently reliable resource solution.

teams.name: One Grain of Rice
teams.loan_because: We love to share!
teams.description: There is an old tale about a clever girl named Rani who saved her people from starvation by requesting, as her reward for a good deed, just one grain of rice doubled every day for thirty days. The raja thinks this is a foolish and paltry reward, but he soon learns the magnitude of this doubling. Rani's request of one grain of rice doubles into millions of grains of rice and all ends well.
